duties_responsibilities.duty: Conduct short-range planning and scheduling operational processes to ensure overall job readiness and minimize safety exposures.
Assist in providing reliable support to operations supervision by planning and scheduling activities, managing the work queue, staffing, equipment, and materials.
Develop a firm two-week plan of assigned operations center activities and a one-month projection of anticipated future activities.
Coordinating work request activities and performing pre-construction work request assessments.
Ensuring safety compliance, job readiness, and safe work practices.
Participating in interactions with internal/external customers on inquiries concerning construction and maintenance activities.
Managing time and priorities, and providing reliable support to supervision by planning and scheduling activities.
Physically visiting jobs to determine the job readiness state and communicating before jobs are dispatched.
Ensure UG Utility locates, switching/hold offs are completed, and reflecting lines employees crewing and vehicle assignments.
Assisting during emergencies and storm-related activities and traveling to various off-site locations as well as office locations, training facilities, and customer sites.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Engineering Technology or related discipline and 1 to 4 years related work experience is required. In lieu of Bachelor's Degree, minimum 3 to 5 years related work experience is required.
